organization.name: Nitrogen Urban Network
organization.mission: Empowering urban communities through sustainable development and environmental justice initiatives.

team.name: Sarah Johnson
team.title: Executive Director
team.bio: 20 years experience in urban development and community organizing.

team.name: Marcus Williams
team.title: Programs Director
team.bio: Specializes in environmental justice and community engagement.

past_programs.name: Green Alleys Initiative
past_programs.description: Transformed 15 urban alleys into green spaces with native plants and sustainable drainage.
past_programs.impact: Reduced flooding by 40% and created 5 new community gathering spaces.

past_programs.name: Youth Urban Farmers
past_programs.description: Trained 50 youth in urban farming techniques and entrepreneurship.
past_programs.impact: Created 3 community gardens that provide fresh produce to 200+ families.

organization.case_for_support: Nitrogen Urban Network addresses the critical issues of environmental inequality and food insecurity in Detroit's underserved neighborhoods. Our holistic approach combines urban agriculture, sustainable infrastructure development, and youth empowerment to create lasting positive change. Through our programs, we've transformed vacant lots into productive gardens, trained youth in valuable skills, and advocated for policies that support environmental justice. Our work not only improves the physical environment but also builds community resilience, creates economic opportunities, and empowers residents to become agents of change in their neighborhoods. With additional support, we can expand our impact to more neighborhoods, reach more youth, and develop innovative solutions to the complex challenges facing urban communities.
